listing.name: Wonderful apartment in old centre

user.about:
Me and my girlfriend Vanessa love to travel and take in new cultures. Preferably by spending time with locals and visiting markets. Cooking and eating together and finding new treasures. We are very lucky to be able do do just that while abroad for work 3 months of the year for the Dutch, Danish and Norwegian Survivor TV-shows.

We currently live on the lovely northern past of Amsterdam with our dog Spook who loves to run around in the park across the street. Our house in the city center is completely adapted for the comfort of our guests and more permanently rented out via Airbnb. We take great pride in taking care of the houses and fill them with all the things we love. One of us or our friend (who lives around the corner) will be there to welcome you and show you the house, and naturally you can contact us with whatever question you may have.

listing.access:
The house is all set for having guests. It is all yours.
It has on official "shortstay permit" from the Amsterdam municipality and therefore is rented the whole year round.
listing.description:
A spacious ground level apartment on a quiet square in the middle of the dynamic city centre. Perfect for 2, but also for 4 since there is a second bedroom. Huge and luxurious bathroom for Amsterdam standards.
Feeling home will describe most of it!

Late check in fee

If you need to check in to the apartment between 21:00 (9PM) and midnight, this is possible, but there is an additional fee of €25, after midnight that will be €50. Thank you for understanding.
listing.house_rules:
I would like to give you all the freedom of the world. But since this is not a hotel, but a house in a homey environment there are a few rules which should be obtained.

First of all. Please keep things clean and leave it as you've found it. I have renovated the house myself a few years ago and it is very dear to me. Use it in a responsible and respectful way.

No partying
No excessive drinking
No use or influenze of any hard drugs.

Smoking though is allowed.

Most important::. An older lady - very sweet - is living above. Although the house is well insulated loud music or screaming will be heard by her. So if you think you should categorize yourself as loud people please do not book.

And last but not least: Please keep consideration to the neighbourhood!

Thank you
listing.interaction:
If possible I - or Vanessa, my girlfriend - will welcome our new guests. However there are moments that this will not be possible since we work a lot abroad and when we do not work we prefer to reside in our house in France. 
Therefore we asked another company to do this for us. They are named 'the friendly host'. They will take care of the apartment, clean it, be there to welcome you and/or when you checkout. Take care when there are emergencies etc etc. Actually THEY are the perfect host! 

Beside that there is the backup of a keysafe I have installed on the entrance door. With the code it will always be possible to let yourself in. A house manual will tell you all you need to know. Very handy.
listing.notes:
Late check in fee

If you need to check in to the apartment between 21:00 (9PM) and midnight, this is possible, but there is an additional fee of €25, after midnight that will be €50. Thank you for understanding.

listing.space:
Great apartment, centrally situated in the historic centre, just a 5 minutes walk from Dam Square, in between Nieuwmarkt and Waterlooplein. 

Complete comfort in a newly renovated 60m2 ground floor appartment.
Entrance immediately in the living area including an open kitchen, a master bedroom with direct access to the amazing bathroom. To host more guest there is a small second bedroom. No sharing, it will be all for you!

The bathroom has a very comfortable dual-headed shower and a real jacuzi (bubbles and waterjets). There is immediate access from the central living area but it is also connected to the main bedroom via two sliding doors to create an intimate space.
The main bedroom has a 1m40 width bed (200 long and 80 cm high), with a good and firm mattress and a feather duvet.
The small room has a 2m long adjustable bed which can be set as a single or a double bed.
Kitchen is well equipped. It includes a refrigerator-freezer, an oven/microwave, stove and dishwasher. There is all kind of cookware and kitchen utensils.

Next to the kitchen is a table with 4 chairs. The living is in the front of the house. There is small LCD HD television with DVD-player (and a whole range of movies), a music installation and wireless internet.
The whole apartment has supercomfortable floor heating underneath the solid oak floor. 

Although the apartment is very centrally located (few minutes from waterlooplein. Rembrand House, Red lights, with all the benefits from that (shops, bars, musea), the old church square where it's located is an escape from the crowdy streets around. With on the other side, just 50m (really! Might even be less) away the entrance to the subway (nieuwmarkt).


It's a unique, modern and comfortable apartment on a great central spot, opposite the old Zuiderkerk, the first church build for protestant services in 1614 and according to local legend Rembrandt has painted his masterpiece Night Watch at the church.

The apartment includes also:

- Towels and linnen
- Washer, dryer and Iron utilities
- Coffee, thee and basic spices, herbs and oil

- A printer/copier/scanner.

- Baby cot and children chair available
listing.summary:
A spacious ground level apartment on a quiet square in the middle of the dynamic city centre. Perfect for 2, but also for 4 since there is a second bedroom. Huge and luxurious bathroom for Amsterdam standards.
Feeling home will describe most of it!
listing.transit:
CAR and PARKING:
Since it's Amsterdam city centre parking is very difficult and expensive (5 euro an hour). There is nevertheless a parking garages for 25 euro a day nearby (5min walk), Even better is to leave your car outside of town at the P+R transferium Amsterdam Arena (the Ajax Stadium) and take the metro. For only 8 euro a day which includes tickets for 5 people you can leave your car there. The metro will take you there in less than 15 minutes. Safe, not expensive and easy.
Loading and unloading is therefore quite easy since the house is on the end of a no-through road.

PUBLIC TRANSPORT
The entrance to the metro (Nieuwmarkt, exit snoekjessteeg) is only 50 metres from the house. Nearest trams are 5 minutes away in all directions and Central Station is a 15 minute walk.
Travelling from and to Schiphol Airport is easy by taking a train. It will take about an hour from door to door. Taking a taxi is possible too. Prices vary from around 40 to 50 euros (from the airport).

review.comments:
Jeroen was an excellent host. The check in/check out process was very detailed prior to our trip. Check in was a breeze as we met with his cleaning crew, David. We requested an earlier check in which Jeoren was kind enough to work with us.

The location can't be more ideal, right at the old center, very convenient to everything. A huge plus is that this apartment is on ground level, very easy without carrying luggage in the narrow staircases. The apartment is also right next to the south church. The bells ring every 15 minutes. It definitely took us a little to get used to but we didn't find it annoying. 

We stayed here as a family with a young baby and it worked well for us. This apartment can fit four people very comfortably. We loved our stay at this apartment and in Amsterdam. Should we return, we will definitely stay here again.
